intro: Capparis ovata subsp. myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf caper, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by edible, citrus-like fruits. Its root system is deep, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
